title: Authors and Citation
text: Tobias Schmidt. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Schmidt T (2023). toscutil: Utility Functions. R package version 2.7.1, https://toscm.github.io/toscutil/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {toscutil: Utility Functions},   author = {Tobias Schmidt},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 2.7.1},   url = {https://toscm.github.io/toscutil/}, }

title: Utility Functions
text: Useful functions everyday programming.

title: Utility Functions
text: Installation Usage Contribute

title: Utility Functions
code: # From CRAN (stable version) install.packages("toscutil") # From Github (development version) devtools::install_github("toscm/toscutil")

title: Utility Functions
text: use function data object, first install package just enter object’s fully qualified name running R session, e.g. toscutil::now_ms(). can find curated list existing functions toscm.github.io/toscutil/. Alternatively, can load package first, using command library("toscutil") access symbol directly name, e.g. now_ms().

title: Utility Functions
text: Things can update, : Function code folder R Function documentation folder R Package documentation folder vignettes Test cases folder tests Dependencies file DESCRIPTION Authors file DESCRIPTION Whenever update things, run commands check everything still working expected steps, can push changes Github use following commands release package CRAN: steps based : https://r-pkgs.org/release.html
code: devtools::test() # Execute tests from tests folder devtools::check() # Check package formalities devtools::document() # Build files in man folder devtools::install() # Install as required by next command pkgdown::build_site() # Build website in docs folder rcmdcheck::rcmdcheck() # Slower, but more realistic test than devtools::check() devtools::spell_check() # Check spelling. Add false positives to inst/WORDLIST devtools::submit_cran() # Submits the package to CRAN revdepcheck::revdep_check(num_workers = 8) # Reverse dependency check # See https://r-pkgs.org/release.html#sec-release-revdep-checks for details

title: Docstring Template — DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE
text: minimal docstring template

title: Docstring Template — DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE
text: single string, .e. character vector length 1.

title: Docstring Template — DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE
code: DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE #> [1] "#' @title TODO (e.g. 'Sum of Vector Elements')\n#' @description TODO (e.g. 'sum returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments.'\n"

what: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
text: Returns name calling function string, .e. function g calls function f function f calls caller(2), string "g" returned.

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
Get Name of Calling Function — caller
text: n many frames go call stack

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
text: Name calling function

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
text: careful using caller(n) input functions. Due R's non-standard-evaluation (NES) mechanism possible function executed directly function instead passed functions, .e. correct number frames go predicted priori. Solutions evaluate function first, store result variable pass variable function just try required number frames go interactive session. examples see section Examples.

title: Get Name of Calling Function — caller
code: # Here we want to return a list of all variables created inside a function f <- function(a = 1, b = 2) {   x <- 3   y <- 4   return(locals(without = formalArgs(caller(4))))   # We need to go 4 frames up, to catch the formalArgs of `f`, because the   # `caller(4)` argument is not evaluated directly be `formalArgs`. } f() # returns either list(x = 3, y = 4) or list(y = 4, x = 3) #> $y #> [1] 4 #>  #> $x #> [1] 3 #>   # The same result could have been achieved as follows g <- function(a = 1, b = 2) {   x <- 3   y <- 4   func <- caller(1)   return(locals(without = c("func", formalArgs(func)))) } g() # returns either list(x = 3, y = 4) or list(y = 4, x = 3) #> $y #> [1] 4 #>  #> $x #> [1] 3 #>

what: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
text: Like classic capture.output(), additional arguments collapse trim.

title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
Capture output from a command — capture.output2
text: ... Arguments passed capture.output(). collapse TRUE, lines collapsed single string. FALSE, lines returned . character, lines collapsed using character. trim TRUE, leading trailing whitespace line removed lines collapsed /returned.

title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
text: collapse TRUE "\n", character vector length 1. Else, character vector length n, n corresponds number lines outputted expression passed capture.output().

title: Capture output from a command — capture.output2
code: x <- capture.output2(str(list(a=1, b=2, c=1:3))) cat2(x) #> List of 3 #>  $ a: num 1 #>  $ b: num 2 #>  $ c: int [1:3] 1 2 3

title: Concatenate and Print — cat0

x <- 1 cat("x:", x, "

what: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
text: config_dir returns absolute, normalized path configuration directory program/package/app based optional app-specific commandline argument, optional app-specific environment variable XDG Base Directory Specification

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
code: config_dir(   app_name,   cl_arg = {      commandArgs()[grep("--config-dir", commandArgs()) + 1]  },   env_var = Sys.getenv(toupper(paste0(app_name, "_config_dir()"))),   create = FALSE,   sep = "/" )

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
text: app_name Name program/package/app cl_arg Value app specific commandline parameter env_var Value app specific environment variable create whether create returned path, exists yet sep Path separator used Windows

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
text: Normalized path configuration directory $app_name.

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir
text: following algorithm used determine location configuration directory application $app_name: parameter cl_arg non-empty string, return Else, parameter env_var non-empty string, return Else, environment variable (EV) XDG_CONFIG_HOME exists, return $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/$app_name Else, EV HOME exists, return $HOME/.config/{app_name} Else, EV USERPROFILE exists, return $USERPROFILE/.config/{app_name} Else, return $WD/.config/{app-name} $WD equals current working directory notation $VAR used specify value parameter environment variable VAR.

title: Get Normalized Configuration Directory Path of a Program — config_dir

what: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
text: config_file returns absolute, normalized path configuration file program/package/app based optional app-specific commandline argument, optional app-specific environment variable XDG Base Directory Specification

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
code: config_file(   app_name,   file_name,   cl_arg = {      commandArgs()[grep("--config-file", commandArgs()) + 1]  },   env_var = "",   sep = "/",   copy_dir = norm_path(xdg_config_home(), app_name),   fallback_path = NULL )

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
text: app_name Name program/package/app file_name Name configuration file cl_arg Value app specific commandline parameter env_var Value app specific environment variable sep Path separator used Windows copy_dir Path directory $fallback_path copied case gets used. fallback_path Value return fallback (see details)

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
text: Normalized path configuration file $app_name.

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file
text: following algorithm used determine location $file_name: $cl_arg non-empty string, return Else, $env_var non-empty string, return Else, $PWD/.config/$app_name exists, return Else, $XDG_CONFIG_HOME/$app_name/$file_name exists, return Else, $HOME/.config/$app_name/$file_name exists, return Else, $USERPROFILE/.config/$app_name/$file_name exists, return Else, $copy_dir non-empty string $fallback_path path existing file, try copy $fallback_path copy_dir/$file_name return copy_dir/$file_name (Note, case $copy_dir non-valid path, function throw error.) Else, return $fallback_path

title: Get Normalized Configuration File Path of a Program — config_file

what: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
text: data_dir returns absolute, normalized path data directory program/package/app based optional app-specific commandline argument, optional app-specific environment variable XDG Base Directory Specification

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
code: data_dir(   app_name,   cl_arg = commandArgs()[grep("--data-dir", commandArgs()) + 1],   env_var = Sys.getenv(toupper(paste0(app_name, "_DATA_DIR"))),   create = FALSE,   sep = "/" )

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
text: app_name Name program/package/app cl_arg Value app specific commandline parameter env_var Value app specific environment variable create whether create returned path, exists yet sep Path separator used Windows

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
text: Normalized path data directory $app_name.

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir
text: following algorithm used determine location data directory application $app_name: parameter $cl_arg non-empty string, return cl_arg Else, parameter $env_var non-empty string, return $env_var Else, environment variable (EV) $XDG_DATA_HOME exists, return $XDG_DATA_HOME/$app_name Else, EV $HOME exists, return $HOME/.local/share/$app_name Else, EV $USERPROFILE exists, return $USERPROFILE/.local/share/$app_name Else, return $WD/.local/share

title: Get Normalized Data Directory Path of a Program — data_dir

what: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
text: Like classic dput(), instead writing stdout, text representation returned string.

title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
text: ... Arguments passed dput(). collapse Character use collapsing lines. trim TRUE, leading trailing whitespace line cleared lines collapsed /returned.

title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
text: collapse == '\n', character vector length 1. Else, character vector length n, n corresponds number lines outputted classic dput().

title: Return ASCII representation of an R object — dput2
code: # Classic dput prints directly to stdout x <- iris[1,] dput(x) #> structure(list(Sepal.Length = 5.1, Sepal.Width = 3.5, Petal.Length = 1.4,  #>     Petal.Width = 0.2, Species = structure(1L, levels = c("setosa",  #>     "versicolor", "virginica"), class = "factor")), row.names = 1L, class = "data.frame")  # Traditional formatting using dput2 y <- dput2(x, collapse = "\n", trim = FALSE) cat2(y) #> structure(list(Sepal.Length = 5.1, Sepal.Width = 3.5, Petal.Length = 1.4,  #>     Petal.Width = 0.2, Species = structure(1L, levels = c("setosa",  #>     "versicolor", "virginica"), class = "factor")), row.names = 1L, class = "data.frame")  # Single line formatting z <- dput2(x) cat2(z) #> structure(list(Sepal.Length = 5.1, Sepal.Width = 3.5, Petal.Length = 1.4, Petal.Width = 0.2, Species = structure(1L, levels = c("setosa", "versicolor", "virginica"), class = "factor")), row.names = 1L, class = "data.frame")

what: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
text: Returns function environment list. Raises error called outside function. default, objects specified arguments removed environment.

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
text: without character vector symbols exclude strip_function_args Whether exclude symbols name function arguments

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
text: function environment list

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
text: order symbols returned list arbitrary.

title: Get Function Environment as List — function_locals
code: f <- function(a = 1, b = 2) {   x <- 3   y <- 4   return(function_locals()) } all.equal(setdiff(f(), list(x = 3, y = 4)), list()) #> [1] "Attributes: < Modes: list, NULL >"                    #> [2] "Attributes: < Lengths: 1, 0 >"                        #> [3] "Attributes: < names for target but not for current >" #> [4] "Attributes: < current is not list-like >"

what: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
text: roxygen2 package makes possible write documentation R functions directly corresponding function. function can used retrieve full documentation string (docstring).

title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
code: get_docstring(content, func, collapse = TRUE, template = DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE)

title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
text: content R code string. func Name function get docstring . collapse Whether collapse docstring single string. template String return case docstring found.

title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
text: character vector length 1 containing either docstring empty string (case documentation detected).

title: Get docstring for a Function — get_docstring
code:
uri <- system.file("testfiles/funcs.R", package = "toscutil") content <- readLines(uri) func <- "f2" get_docstring(content, func) #> [1] "#' @title Sum of Vector Elements
#' @description f3 returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments.
#' @param b TODO
#' @param a Already documented
#' @export
#' @param z Multiline description
#'
#' of parameter z.
#'
#' @param ... unused
#' @details This is a generic function: methods can be defined for it directly
#' or via the Summary group generic. For this to work properly, the arguments
#' ... should be unnamed, and dispatch is on the first argument.
" get_docstring(content, func, collapse = TRUE) #> [1] "#' @title Sum of Vector Elements
#' @description f3 returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments.
#' @param b TODO
#' @param a Already documented
#' @export
#' @param z Multiline description
#'
#' of parameter z.
#'
#' @param ... unused
#' @details This is a generic function: methods can be defined for it directly
#' or via the Summary group generic. For this to work properly, the arguments
#' ... should be unnamed, and dispatch is on the first argument.
"

what: Get formals of a Function — get_formals
title: Get formals of a Function — get_formals
text: Returns arguments function valid R file.

title: Get formals of a Function — get_formals
Get formals of a Function — get_formals
text: uri Path R file. content R code string. func Function name. function defined multiple times inside provided file, last occurence considered.

title: Get formals of a Function — get_formals
text: named character vector returned formals().

title: Get formals of a Function — get_formals
code: uri <- system.file("testfiles/funcs.R", package = "toscutil") content <- readLines(uri) func <- "f2" get_formals(uri, content, func) #> $a #>  #>  #> $b #>  #>  #> $x #> [1] 1 #>  #> $... #>  #>

title: Get File Directory — getfd
text: Return full path current file directory

title: Get File Directory — getfd
code: getfd(   on.error = stop("No file sourced. Maybe you're in an interactive shell?", call. =     FALSE),   winslash = "/" )

title: Get File Directory — getfd
text: .error Expression use current file directory determined. case, normalizePath(.error, winslash) returned. Can also expression like stop("message") stop execution (default). winslash Path separator use windows

title: Get File Directory — getfd
text: Current file directory string

title: Get Project Directory — getpd
text: Find project root directory traversing current working directory filepath upwards given set files found.

title: Get Project Directory — getpd
text: root.files files found parent folder, path folder returned

title: Get Project Directory — getpd
text: getpd returns absolute, normalized project root directory string. forward slash used path separator (independent OS).

title: Return help for topic — help2
text: function returns help text specified topic formatted either plain text, html latex.

title: Return help for topic — help2
text: topic character, topic return help text. See argument topic function help() details. format character, either "text", "html" "latex" package character, package return help text. argument ignored topic specified. Package must attached search list first, e.g. calling library(package).

title: Return help for topic — help2
text: function copied part : https://www.r-bloggers.com/2013/06/printing-r-help-files---console---knitr-documents/

title: Return help for topic — help2
code: htm <- help2("sum", "html") txt <- help2(topic = "sum", format = "text") cat2(txt) #> _S_u_m _o_f _V_e_c_t_o_r _E_l_e_m_e_n_t_s #>  #> _D_e_s_c_r_i_p_t_i_o_n: #>  #>      ‘sum’ returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments. #>  #> _U_s_a_g_e: #>  #>      sum(..., na.rm = FALSE) #>       #> _A_r_g_u_m_e_n_t_s: #>  #>      ...: numeric or complex or logical vectors. #>  #>    na.rm: logical.  Should missing values (including ‘NaN’) be removed? #>  #> _D_e_t_a_i_l_s: #>  #>      This is a generic function: methods can be defined for it directly #>      or via the ‘Summary’ group generic.  For this to work properly, #>      the arguments ‘...’ should be unnamed, and dispatch is on the #>      first argument. #>  #>      If ‘na.rm’ is ‘FALSE’ an ‘NA’ or ‘NaN’ value in any of the #>      arguments will cause a value of ‘NA’ or ‘NaN’ to be returned, #>      otherwise ‘NA’ and ‘NaN’ values are ignored. #>  #>      Logical true values are regarded as one, false values as zero. #>      For historical reasons, ‘NULL’ is accepted and treated as if it #>      were ‘integer(0)’. #>  #>      Loss of accuracy can occur when summing values of different signs: #>      this can even occur for sufficiently long integer inputs if the #>      partial sums would cause integer overflow.  Where possible #>      extended-precision accumulators are used, typically well supported #>      with C99 and newer, but possibly platform-dependent. #>  #> _V_a_l_u_e: #>  #>      The sum.  If all of the ‘...’ arguments are of type integer or #>      logical, then the sum is ‘integer’ when possible and is ‘double’ #>      otherwise.  Integer overflow should no longer happen since R #>      version 3.5.0.  For other argument types it is a length-one #>      numeric (‘double’) or complex vector. #>  #>      *NB:* the sum of an empty set is zero, by definition. #>  #> _S_4 _m_e_t_h_o_d_s: #>  #>      This is part of the S4 ‘Summary’ group generic.  Methods for it #>      must use the signature ‘x, ..., na.rm’. #>  #>      ‘plotmath’ for the use of ‘sum’ in plot annotation. #>  #> _R_e_f_e_r_e_n_c_e_s: #>  #>      Becker, R. A., Chambers, J. M. and Wilks, A. R. (1988) _The New S #>      Language_.  Wadsworth & Brooks/Cole. #>  #> _S_e_e _A_l_s_o: #>  #>      ‘colSums’ for row and column sums. #>  #> _E_x_a_m_p_l_e_s: #>  #>      ## Pass a vector to sum, and it will add the elements together. #>      sum(1:5) #>       #>      ## Pass several numbers to sum, and it also adds the elements. #>      sum(1, 2, 3, 4, 5) #>       #>      ## In fact, you can pass vectors into several arguments, and everything gets added. #>      sum(1:2, 3:5) #>       #>      ## If there are missing values, the sum is unknown, i.e., also missing, .... #>      sum(1:5, NA) #>      ## ... unless  we exclude missing values explicitly: #>      sum(1:5, NA, na.rm = TRUE) #>

title: Get USERPROFILE or HOME — home

what: Shortcut for multiple if else statements — ifthen
title: Shortcut for multiple if else statements — ifthen
text: ifthen(, b, c, d, e, f, ...) == () b else (c) d else (e) f

title: Shortcut for multiple if else statements — ifthen
Shortcut for multiple if else statements — ifthen
text: ... pairs checks corresponding return values

title: Shortcut for multiple if else statements — ifthen
text: ifelse returns first value corresponding statement evaluates TRUE

title: Shortcut for multiple if else statements — ifthen
code: x <- 2; y <- 2; z <- 1 ifthen(x == 0 , "foo", y == 0, "bar", z == 1, "this string gets returned") #> [1] "this string gets returned"

what: Truth checking as in Python — is.none
title: Truth checking as in Python — is.none
text: Returns TRUE x either FALSE, 0, NULL, NAand empty lists empty string. Inspired python's bool.

title: Truth checking as in Python — is.none
Truth checking as in Python — is.none
text: x object test

title: Truth checking as in Python — is.none
text: TRUE x FALSE, 0, NULL, NA, empty list empty string. Else FALSE.

title: Truth checking as in Python — is.none
code: is.none(FALSE) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is.none(0) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is.none(1) # FALSE #> [1] FALSE is.none(NA) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is.none(list()) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is.none("") # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is.none(character()) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is.none(numeric()) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE is.none(logical()) # TRUE #> [1] TRUE

title: Create automatically named List — named
code: a <- 1:10; b <- "helloworld" l1 <- list(a, b) names(l1) <- c("a", "b") l2 <- named(a, b) identical(l1, l2) #> [1] FALSE l3 <- list(z=a, b=b) l4 <- named(z=a, b) identical(l3, l4) #> [1] TRUE

what: Get Current Date and Time as string — now
title: Get Current Date and Time as string — now
text: now returns current system time string form YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss TZ, TZ means "timezone".

title: Get Current Date and Time as string — now
Get Current Date and Time as string — now
text: now returns current system time string form YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss TZ, TZ means "timezone" (strictly speaking, format given format() %Y-%m-%d %H:%M:%S, details see [format.POSIXct()]).

title: Return Default if None — op-null-default
text: x object test y object return .none(x)

title: Return Default if None — op-null-default
text: Returns y .none(x) else x

title: Return Default if None — op-null-default
code: FALSE %none% 2 # returns 2 #> [1] 2 0 %none% 2 # returns 2 #> [1] 2 NA %none% 2 # returns 2 #> [1] 2 list() %none% 2 # returns 2 #> [1] 2 "" %none% 2 # returns 2 #> [1] 2 1 %none% 2 # returns 1 #> [1] 1

what: Predict Method for Numeric Vectors — predict.numeric
title: Predict Method for Numeric Vectors — predict.numeric
text: Interprets provided numeric vector linear model uses generate predictions. element numeric vector name "Intercept" element treated intercept linear model.

code: # S3 method for numeric predict(object, newdata, ...)

title: Predict Method for Numeric Vectors — predict.numeric

title: Predict Method for Numeric Vectors — predict.numeric
text: Named numeric vector predicted scores

title: Predict Method for Numeric Vectors — predict.numeric
code: X <- matrix(1:4, 2, 2, dimnames = list(c("s1", "s2"), c("a", "b"))) b <- c(Intercept = 3, a = 2, b = 1) predict(b, X) #> s1 s2  #>  8 11

text: Split docstring head, param tail part.

title: Split a docstring into a Head, Param and Tail Part — split_docstring
Split a docstring into a Head, Param and Tail Part — split_docstring
text: docstring Docstring R function string, .e. character vector length 1.

title: Split a docstring into a Head, Param and Tail Part — split_docstring
text: List 3 elements: head, param tail.

title: Split a docstring into a Head, Param and Tail Part — split_docstring
code: uri <- system.file("testfiles/funcs.R", package = "toscutil") func <- "f4" content <- readLines(uri) docstring <- get_docstring(content, func) split_docstring(docstring) #> $head #>                                                                                           header  #>                                                                                               ""  #>                                                                                            title  #>                                               "#' @title TODO (e.g. 'Sum of Vector Elements')\n"  #>                                                                                      description  #> "#' @description TODO (e.g. 'sum returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments.'\n"  #>  #> $param #> named character(0) #>  #> $tail #> named character(0) #>

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
text: stub() assigns arguments given function symbols specified environment (usually current environment)

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
text: func function arguments stubbed ... non-default arguments func envir environment symbols assigned

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
text: list symbols assigned envir

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
text: Stub thought used interactive testing unit testing. work primitive functions.

title: Stub Function Arguments — stub
code: f <- function(x, y = 2, z = 3) x + y + z args <- stub(f, x = 1) # assigns x = 1, y = 2 and z = 3 to current env

what: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
text: Similar python's sys.exit. used interactively, code execution stopped error message, giving provided status code. used non-interactively (e.g. Rscript), code execution stopped silently process exits provided status code.

title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
text: status exitcode R process

title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
text: return value, called side effects

title: Terminate a non-interactive R Session — sys.exit
code: if (FALSE) { if (!file.exists("some.file")) {   cat("Error: some.file does not exist.\n", file = stderr())   sys.exit(1) } else if (Sys.getenv("IMPORTANT_ENV") == "") {   cat("Error: IMPORTANT_ENV not set.\n", file = stderr())   sys.exit(2) } else {   cat("Everything good. Starting calculations...")   # ...   cat("Finished with success!")   sys.exit(0) } }

what: Update docstring for a Function — update_docstring
title: Update docstring for a Function — update_docstring
text: roxygen2 package makes possible write documentation R functions directly corresponding function. function can used update parameter list documentation string (docstring) valid function valid R file. update done comparing currently listed parameters actual function parameters. Outdated parameters removed missing parameters added docstring.

title: Update docstring for a Function — update_docstring
Update docstring for a Function — update_docstring
text: uri Path R file. func Function name. function defined multiple times inside provided file, last occurence considered. content R code string. provided, uri ignored.

title: Update docstring for a Function — update_docstring
text: character vector length 1 containing updated docstring.

title: Update docstring for a Function — update_docstring
code:
uri <- system.file("testfiles/funcs.R", package = "toscutil") func <- "f4" update_docstring(uri, func) #> [1] "#' @title TODO (e.g. 'Sum of Vector Elements')
#' @description TODO (e.g. 'sum returns the sum of all the values present in its arguments.'
#' @param a TODO
#' @param b TODO
#' @param x TODO
#' @param ... TODO
"

title: Get XDG_CONFIG_HOME — xdg_config_home
text: Return value XDG_CONFIG_HOME defined XDG Base Directory Specification

title: Get XDG_CONFIG_HOME — xdg_config_home
text: sep Path separator used Windows fallback Value return fallback (see details)

title: Get XDG_CONFIG_HOME — xdg_config_home
text: following algorithm used determine returned path: environment variable (EV) XDG_CONFIG_HOME exists, return value Else, EV HOME exists, return $HOME/.config Else, EV USERPROFILE exists, return $USERPROFILE/.config Else, return $fallback

title: Get XDG_DATA_HOME — xdg_data_home
text: Return value XDG_DATA_HOME defined XDG Base Directory Specification

title: Get XDG_DATA_HOME — xdg_data_home
text: sep Path separator used Windows fallback Value return fallback (see details)

title: Get XDG_DATA_HOME — xdg_data_home
text: following algorithm used determine returned path: environment variable (EV) $XDG_DATA_HOME exists, return value Else, EV $HOME exists, return $HOME/.local/share Else, EV $USERPROFILE exists, return $USERPROFILE/.local/share Else, return $fallback

title: toscutil v2.7.1
text: Fixed: Fixed split_docstring(). Docstrings ending keyword, e.g. @export now returned correctly without additional whitespace.

title: toscutil v2.7.0
text: Added: Added pkgdown website Added: Added functions capture.output2(), dput2(), get_docstring(), get_formals(), update_docstring() Added: Added constant DOCSTRING_TEMPLATE Changed: Improved documentation almost every function Removed: Removed function reference README.md Deprecated: Functions cat0(), catn(), cat0n(), catsn(), catnn(), catfn()

title: toscutil v2.6.0
text: Added: Added function help2 Infrastructure: Added function reference README.md

title: toscutil v2.5.1
text: Fixed: Function .none now also handles atomic vectors length 0, e.g. character(), numeric() logical()

title: toscutil v2.5.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-06-30 Added: Added functions caller, function_locals, locals, now_ms stub Changed: Changed default values function cat2 Changed: Changed return value function now. Timezone returned well, .e. instead "2022-12-24 11:13:57" something like "2022-12-24 11:13:57 CEST" returned. Changed: Added dependencies core packages "methods" "utils" 3rd party package "rlang". Changed: Changed package Title “Utility Functions Tobias Schmidt (ToSc)” “Utility Functions” Fixed: Made function predict.numeric robust (check classes “matrix” “array” now done using function inherits). Deprecated: Deprecated functions cat0, catn, cat0n, catsn catnn

title: toscutil v2.4.0
text: Added: Added functions config_dir, data_dir, norm_path, config_file, xdg_data_home, xdg_config_home,

title: toscutil v2.3.0
text: Added: Added functions catsn, catnn, catf catfn

title: toscutil v2.2.0
text: Added: Added function home

title: toscutil v2.1.0
text: CRAN release: 2022-02-22 Infrastructure: Added details package functionality implemented methods field Description file DESCRIPTION Fixed: Replaced F FALSE getfd.{R|Rd} Fixed: Updated function documentation. Every function now contains least following roxygen tags: name, title, description, return, .e., corresponding *.Rd-files contain least following tags \name, \title , \value, \description. Added: Argument end cat variants

title: toscutil v2.0.3

title: toscutil v2.0.1
text: Fixed: Removed man folder .gitignore Fixed: Changed License entry DESCRIPTION MIT + file LICENSE prevent R CMD check note Fixed: Made repo public prevent invalid URL note R CMD check Fixed: Converted title DESCRIPTION title case prevent R CMD check note

title: toscutil v2.0.0
text: Removed: cache function, downstream dependencies caused problems R CMD check Fixed: Documentation cat0, catn, cat0n Fixed: Documentation ifthen Fixed: Documentation rm_all Changed: predict.numeric use paste instead glue::glue remove dependency package glue
